revised_title: Discovery of a Lungless Caecilian: A New Evolutionary Trajectory in Amphibians
tldr: The authors discovered a new species of lungless caecilian, Typhlonectes eiselti, which is the largest known lungless vertebrate. This caecilian has a unique combination of morphological features, such as sealed choanae, complete absence of pulmonary blood vessels, and a repatterned skull. The discovery of lunglessness in caecilians expands our understanding of the evolution of this amphibian group and their respiratory adaptations.
